storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view real-time attendance dashboards to achieve immediate insight into team attendance status

testCases.title: Validate real-time dashboard data display
preconditions: Manager has valid credentials with dashboard access permissions
Attendance database contains current day attendance records
Dashboard portal is accessible and operational
Manager has access to at least one team/department
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge latest versions)

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard portal URL
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid manager credentials (username and password) and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Manager is authenticated and dashboard loads displaying current attendance metrics including present, absent, and late arrivals counts

steps.action: Verify dashboard displays real-time data with timestamp showing last update within 30 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows current attendance status with timestamp indicating data freshness within 30 seconds

steps.action: Select a specific team from the team filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Team filter is applied and dropdown shows selected team

steps.action: Select a date range using the date range picker (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is applied and dashboard updates to reflect attendance data for the selected team and date range

steps.action: Verify that attendance metrics (present, absent, late) are updated to match the filtered criteria
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays accurate attendance metrics filtered by selected team and date range with trend charts showing data for the specified period

steps.action: Click on a specific employee name or record in the dashboard to drill down
steps.expectedResult: Detailed attendance information panel opens showing individual employee's attendance history including dates, check-in/check-out times, status, and any notes

steps.action: Verify all detailed information is displayed correctly for the selected employee
steps.expectedResult: Employee attendance details are complete, accurate, and match the aggregated data shown in the dashboard

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the dashboard
Dashboard displays filtered data based on last applied filters
Employee detail panel can be closed to return to main dashboard view
Session is active and data continues to refresh every 30 seconds

testCases.title: Verify dashboard export functionality
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard portal
Dashboard is displaying attendance data (with or without filters applied)
Manager has export permissions enabled
Browser allows file downloads
PDF and Excel export functionality is enabled on the system

steps.action: Locate and click the Export button on the dashboard toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog box appears displaying available format options (PDF and Excel)

steps.action: Note the current on-screen data including metrics, team name, date range, and attendance counts for verification
steps.expectedResult: On-screen data is documented for comparison with exported reports

steps.action: Select PDF format option from the export dialog and click Export/Download button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download initiates and file is saved to the downloads folder

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file and verify it contains the same data displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: PDF report matches on-screen data including all metrics, filters applied, date range, team information, and attendance counts. Report is properly formatted and readable

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click the Export button again
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with format options

steps.action: Select Excel format option from the export dialog and click Export/Download button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file download initiates and file is saved to the downloads folder

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file and verify it contains the correct data and formatting
steps.expectedResult: Excel file matches on-screen data with proper column headers, data rows, formatting, and formulas if applicable. All attendance metrics are accurate and match the dashboard display

steps.action: Verify Excel file contains all expected sheets and data is properly structured for further analysis
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is well-structured with clear headers, properly formatted cells, and data that can be manipulated for additional analysis

postconditions: Two export files (PDF and Excel) are saved in the downloads folder
Both exported files contain accurate data matching the dashboard display
Manager remains logged into the dashboard
Dashboard state is unchanged after export operations
Export dialog is closed

testCases.title: Ensure dashboard performance under load
preconditions: Performance testing environment is set up with load testing tools
Multiple manager test accounts are created and configured
Attendance database is populated with realistic data volume
Dashboard application is deployed and operational
Network conditions are stable and monitored
Performance monitoring tools are in place to measure load times

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 20 concurrent manager users accessing the dashboard portal simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with 20 virtual users with valid manager credentials

steps.action: Initiate the load test to have all 20 users log in and access the dashboard at the same time
steps.expectedResult: All 20 virtual users successfully authenticate and request dashboard data concurrently

steps.action: Measure and record the dashboard load time for each of the 20 concurrent users
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 5 seconds for all 20 users. Performance monitoring shows load times are consistently under the 5-second threshold

steps.action: Verify that all users receive the dashboard without errors or timeouts
steps.expectedResult: All 20 users successfully view the dashboard with no error messages, timeouts, or failed requests

steps.action: Compare the attendance data displayed to each concurrent user at the same timestamp
steps.expectedResult: All users see consistent and identical attendance metrics for the same teams and time periods

steps.action: Verify data accuracy by comparing displayed metrics against the source attendance database
steps.expectedResult: All users see up-to-date data that matches the current state of the attendance database with timestamps within 30 seconds of current time

steps.action: Have all concurrent users apply different filters and verify response times
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates with filtered data within 3 seconds for all concurrent users without performance degradation

steps.action: Monitor server resources (CPU, memory, database connections) during the load test
steps.expectedResult: Server resources remain within acceptable limits with no crashes, memory leaks, or database connection exhaustion

postconditions: All 20 concurrent user sessions can be terminated cleanly
Dashboard performance meets the 5-second load time requirement under concurrent load
Data consistency is maintained across all concurrent sessions
System resources return to normal levels after load test completion
No errors or warnings are logged during the load test
Performance test results are documented for future reference

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to filter attendance dashboard data by department and date to achieve focused attendance insights

testCases.title: Validate dashboard filtering by department and date
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard portal
Dashboard is loaded and displaying default attendance data
Manager has access to multiple departments
Attendance database contains records for multiple departments and date ranges
Filter controls are visible and enabled on the dashboard

steps.action: Locate the department filter dropdown on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Department filter dropdown is visible and displays available departments the manager has access to

steps.action: Click on the department filter dropdown and select a specific department (e.g., 'Engineering')
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and displayed in the dropdown

steps.action: Locate the date range filter and click on the date picker control
steps.expectedResult: Date picker calendar interface opens allowing date range selection

steps.action: Select a start date and end date for the desired range (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the date filter field

steps.action: Click Apply or wait for auto-refresh after filter selection
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 3 seconds displaying attendance data filtered by the selected department and date range

steps.action: Verify that the displayed attendance metrics reflect only the selected department and date range
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows attendance data exclusively for the selected department within the specified date range. Metrics, charts, and employee lists are updated accordingly

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Save Filter Preset' or 'Save Filter' button
steps.expectedResult: Save filter dialog appears prompting for a preset name

steps.action: Enter a descriptive name for the filter preset (e.g., 'Engineering Last 30 Days') and click Save
steps.expectedResult: Filter preset is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed. Preset appears in the saved presets list or dropdown

steps.action: Apply different filters or navigate away from the current view, then select the saved preset from the presets dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard immediately applies the saved filter preset and displays data for Engineering department for the last 30 days as originally configured

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All applied filters are removed and dashboard resets to default view showing all departments and default date range

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard displays unfiltered data after clearing filters
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows attendance data for all accessible departments with default date range. Filter controls are reset to default state

postconditions: Filter preset is saved and available for future use
Dashboard is in default unfiltered state after clearing filters
Manager remains logged into the dashboard
All filter controls are functional and ready for new filter applications
Saved preset can be edited or deleted if needed

testCases.title: Verify access control on filtered data
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard portal
Manager has restricted access to specific departments only (e.g., only Engineering and Marketing)
System has departments that the manager does not have access to (e.g., Finance, HR)
Role-based access control is properly configured in the system
Dashboard filter controls are visible and enabled

steps.action: Click on the department filter dropdown to view available departments
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown displays only departments the manager has access to (Engineering and Marketing). Unauthorized departments (Finance, HR) are not visible in the list

steps.action: Verify that unauthorized departments are not present in the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Only authorized departments appear in the dropdown. Finance and HR departments are not listed

steps.action: Attempt to manually construct a URL or API request to access attendance data for an unauthorized department (e.g., Finance) by modifying query parameters
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt and prevents data retrieval

steps.action: Observe the system response to the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: System displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this department's data' or 'Unauthorized access to department'. HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned

steps.action: Verify that no attendance data for the unauthorized department is displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard does not display any attendance metrics, employee names, or other data from the unauthorized department. Error message is clearly visible to the user

steps.action: Check application logs or security audit logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security event is logged with details including manager ID, attempted department access, timestamp, and denial reason

steps.action: Return to normal dashboard operation by selecting an authorized department from the filter
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard functions normally and displays attendance data for the authorized department without any issues

postconditions: Manager's access remains restricted to authorized departments only
No unauthorized data was exposed or displayed
Security event is logged in the audit trail
Dashboard continues to function normally for authorized access
Manager can continue using the dashboard with proper access controls enforced
Error message is dismissed and dashboard is in usable state

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to drill down from summary metrics to individual employee attendance to achieve detailed attendance analysis

testCases.title: Validate drill-down from summary to employee attendance
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard with valid credentials
Manager has appropriate role-based permissions to view employee attendance details
Attendance data is available in the system for the current period
Summary metrics are displayed on the dashboard showing absent count
At least one employee has an absence record in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard and verify summary metrics are visible
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays summary metrics including absent count, present count, and other attendance statistics

steps.action: Click on the absent count metric displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard transitions to drill-down view and displays a list of all absent employees with columns showing employee name, employee ID, date of absence, and absence type. Response time is under 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the number of employees in the drill-down list matches the absent count from the summary metric
steps.expectedResult: The count of employees displayed in the list exactly matches the absent count number shown in the summary metric, confirming data consistency

steps.action: Select an employee from the displayed list by clicking on their name or row
steps.expectedResult: Detailed attendance record view opens for the selected employee showing complete attendance history, including dates, attendance status, leave types, anomalies, and any relevant notes

steps.action: Review the detailed attendance information displayed for accuracy and completeness
steps.expectedResult: All attendance details are displayed correctly with proper formatting, dates are in chronological order, and attendance patterns/anomalies are highlighted if present

steps.action: Click on the 'Back' or 'Return to Summary' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard navigates back to the summary view displaying the original summary metrics without loss of any previously applied filters or settings

steps.action: Verify the summary dashboard is displayed in its original state
steps.expectedResult: Summary dashboard is fully visible with all metrics displayed correctly, maintaining the same state as before the drill-down operation

postconditions: Manager is returned to the summary dashboard view
No data has been modified during the drill-down operation
Session remains active and authenticated
All navigation history is preserved for potential back/forward navigation

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to export attendance dashboard reports to achieve offline analysis and sharing

testCases.title: Validate export of dashboard reports
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard with valid credentials
Manager has appropriate permissions to export attendance reports
Attendance data is available and displayed on the dashboard
Browser allows file downloads and pop-ups are not blocked
Export functionality is enabled in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard and verify data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully showing attendance summary metrics and data for the current period

steps.action: Apply filters to the dashboard by selecting a specific date range (e.g., last 30 days) and department
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays filtered attendance data matching the selected date range and department criteria. Filter tags are visible showing active filters

steps.action: Perform a drill-down operation by clicking on a specific metric (e.g., late arrivals count)
steps.expectedResult: Drill-down view displays showing detailed list of employees matching the late arrivals criteria with the applied filters still active

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Export' button or menu option on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Export options dialog or menu appears displaying available export formats including PDF and Excel options

steps.action: Select 'Export as PDF' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF report generation. Progress indicator or loading message is displayed. PDF file is generated and download begins within 30 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and contains all dashboard data matching the on-screen view including applied filters (date range, department), drill-down data (late arrivals list), employee details, and summary metrics. Report header shows filter criteria and generation timestamp

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click on the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options dialog appears again showing PDF and Excel format options

steps.action: Select 'Export as Excel' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel report generation. Progress indicator is displayed. Excel file (.xlsx) is generated and download begins within 30 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with properly formatted spreadsheet containing all dashboard data. Data includes applied filters, drill-down details, employee information in separate columns, and summary statistics. All data matches the on-screen dashboard view exactly

steps.action: Verify that both exported files contain identical data in their respective formats
steps.expectedResult: PDF and Excel exports contain the same data values, employee counts, metrics, and filter criteria, confirming consistency across export formats

postconditions: Two report files (PDF and Excel) are successfully downloaded to the manager's device
Dashboard remains in the same state with filters and drill-downs still applied
No data has been modified during the export process
Export activity is logged in the system audit trail
Manager session remains active

testCases.title: Verify export error handling
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard with valid credentials
Manager has appropriate permissions to export reports
Test environment allows simulation of export failures
Dashboard is displaying attendance data
System administrator or test setup can trigger report generation failure

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard and verify data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully with attendance data visible

steps.action: Configure the test environment to simulate a report generation failure (e.g., disable report service, simulate database timeout, or trigger server error)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is configured to force export failure on next export attempt

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button and select 'Export as PDF' option
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to generate the PDF report. Progress indicator is displayed showing export is in progress

steps.action: Wait for the system to detect and respond to the simulated failure
steps.expectedResult: System detects the report generation failure and stops the export process gracefully without crashing or freezing the dashboard

steps.action: Observe the error notification displayed to the manager
steps.expectedResult: Clear and user-friendly error message is displayed stating 'Report generation failed. Please try again later or contact support if the issue persists.' Error message includes an error reference ID or timestamp for troubleshooting

steps.action: Verify the dashboard remains functional after the error
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is still fully functional, all data is visible, filters work correctly, and navigation is not impaired. No data loss or corruption occurred

steps.action: Click the 'Close' or 'OK' button on the error message
steps.expectedResult: Error message closes and manager can continue using the dashboard normally

steps.action: Attempt to export again using 'Export as Excel' option while failure condition is still active
steps.expectedResult: System again attempts export, detects failure, and displays the same type of clear error message without system instability

steps.action: Restore the test environment to normal operation (remove failure simulation)
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is restored and export functionality should work normally

steps.action: Attempt to export as PDF again with normal system operation
steps.expectedResult: Export completes successfully and PDF file downloads, confirming system has recovered from error state

postconditions: Dashboard remains stable and functional despite export failures
Error messages have been displayed appropriately to the manager
No partial or corrupted files were downloaded
Export errors are logged in the system error logs for administrator review
System has recovered and can successfully export reports after failure condition is removed
Manager session remains active and authenticated
